dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Generate Stream Branches tool can dissolve a stream network polyline feature class based on GNIS name and stream order to create stream branches in the stream network. Stream branches can then be used for segmenting the network by the longest continuous stretches of stream.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Kelly Whitehead, South Fork Research, Inc.

tool.name: StreamBranchesTool

param.name: InputStreamNetwork
param.dialogReference: Stream network polyline feature class with a stream order attribute (from Calculate Stream Order tool).

param.name: InputJunctionPoints
param.dialogReference: Use the junction points feature class output from the Calculate Stream Order tool to split branches at stream order convergences. Otherwise, the Generate Stream Branches tool will dissolve all stream order segments that converge with the same stream order value.

param.name: fieldStreamName
param.displayname: Primary Stream Name Field (i.e. GNIS Name)
param.dialogReference: Attribute field with stream names, such as the GNIS_Name field. Not all stream reaches need to have a stream name - the tool will use stream order for reaches without a stream name.

param.name: fieldStreamOrder
param.dialogReference: Attribute field containing the stream order for each polyline feature in the input stream network polyline feature class.

param.name: outputStreamOrderFC
param.displayname: Output Line Network with Branch ID
param.dialogReference: Output polyline feature class which will include stream branch IDs as an attribute. The tool will overwrite existing data files.

param.name: boolDissolve
param.dialogReference:
* `Checked`: The output stream network polyline feature class will contain all features dissolved by the `BranchID`. Other feature attributes will be dropped due to the dissolve.

* `Unchecked`: The output stream network will retain its original features and attributes, with the addition of the `BranchID` field.

param.name: InputTempWorkspace
param.dialogReference:
• Can be a file geodatabase or folder. Will be used for saving temporary processing data files.

  • If a workspace is not explicitly designated, the tool will use the "in_memory" workspace. Temporary data will not be accessible, but processing speeds will increase.

tool.summary: The Generate Stream Branches tool can dissolve a stream network polyline feature class based on GNIS name and stream order to create stream branches in the stream network. Stream branches can then be used for segmenting the network by the longest continuous stretches of stream.
